title: How to Reset the Android Tablet Pattern Lock

steps.title: Open your Android's Settings .
steps.content: Open your Android's Settings . To get there, drag the notification panel down from the top of the home screen, then tap the gear at the top-right corner. [1] X Research source If you can't log in to your Android because you've forgotten the existing lock pattern, see another method.

steps.title: Tap the Security menu.
steps.content: Tap the Security menu. You may have to tap Security & Location and then Security on some tablets.

steps.title: Tap Screen lock.
steps.content: Tap Screen lock . You may have to scroll down to see it.

steps.title: Enter your current lock pattern, PIN, or password to continue.
steps.content: Enter your current lock pattern, PIN, or password to continue. You'll only have to do this if you've already set up a lock.

steps.title: Select the Pattern option.
steps.content: Select the Pattern option. This option allows you to trace a pattern across a set of dots rather than enter a PIN or passcode.

steps.title: Drag your finger across 4 or more dots to create a pattern.
steps.content: Drag your finger across 4 or more dots to create a pattern. After drawing the pattern the first time, you'll be prompted to draw it again to verify.

steps.title: Tap Confirm to save your pattern.
steps.content: Tap Confirm to save your pattern. The new pattern will take effect immediately. Practice your new pattern over and over again until you're sure you remember it. If you forget your pattern you won't be able to access any of your data.

steps.title: Go to https://android.com/find on any computer, phone, or tablet.
steps.content: Go to https://android.com/find on any computer, phone, or tablet. If you're using a tablet running Android 4.5 (Lollipop) or later and have forgotten your lock pattern, you'll need to reset your tablet back to its original factory settings. [2] X Research source An easy way to do this is through Find My Device in a web browser. All data on the tablet will be lost unless you've already backed it up. Find My Device is usually enabled by default on Android tablets. If you disabled this feature, try a different method. [3] X Research source If you've enabled Smart Lock to automatically unlock your Android in certain physical locations (such as your home or office), you can just bring the tablet to that location to get back in.

steps.title: Sign in to your Google account.
steps.content: Sign in to your Google account. Be sure to use the same username and password you use to log into the locked tablet.

steps.title: Select your tablet.
steps.content: Select your tablet. You'll only have to select the tablet if you have more than one Android connected to this account.

steps.title: Click Erase and follow the on-screen instructions.
steps.content: Click Erase and follow the on-screen instructions. This will delete the contents of your tablet so you can set it up as new. When the process is complete, you'll be prompted to sign in with your Google account.

steps.title: Set up your tablet as new.
steps.content: Set up your tablet as new. Log in with your Google account, and then follow the on-screen instructions to get your tablet back online. The setup process will also walk you through the process of protecting your Android with a new pattern, PIN, password, or biometric to unlock it in the future.

steps.title: Turn off your tablet.
steps.content: Turn off your tablet. If you're using a tablet running Android 4.5 (Lollipop) or later and have forgotten your lock pattern, you'll need to reset your tablet back to its original factory settings. If you aren't able to use Find My Device to reset the tablet, you can use the keys on the tablet. All data on the tablet will be lost unless you've already backed it up. If you've enabled Smart Lock to automatically unlock your Android in certain physical locations (such as your home or office), you can just bring the tablet to that location to get back in.

steps.title: Press and hold the Volume Up and Power buttons simultaneously.
steps.content: Press and hold the Volume Up and Power buttons simultaneously. You can lift your fingers once the tablet powers on. [4] X Research source The buttons used to enter the recovery menu vary by model. If this combination doesn't work, try Volume Down and Power. Check your manufacturer's website to find the exact combination for your model.

steps.title: Go to the recovery console.
steps.content: Go to the recovery console. Here's how to do this on popular models: Samsung: When the tablet boots to the Samsung screen, use the Volume Up button to select the icon of an Android with an arrow, press the Volume Down button, press Volume Down again to highlight Recovery Console , and then press the Power button. [5] X Research source LG: When you see the "Start" menu, press Volume Down twice to highlight Recovery Mode , and then press the Power button to select it. [6] X Research source Google Pixel: Press the Volume Down button to highlight Restart bootloader , then press Power to select it. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll to and select Wipe Data / Factory Reset.
steps.content: Scroll to and select Wipe Data / Factory Reset . Use the volume keys to navigate to this menu option, then press Power to select it.

steps.title: Select Yes to confirm.
steps.content: Select Yes to confirm. This option may say Yes, delete all user data on some tablets, and you can use the Power button to select it. The tablet will then reset to its original factory settings. Once the reset is complete, you'll be prompted to restart the tablet.

steps.title: Select Reboot System Now to complete the process.
steps.content: Select Reboot System Now to complete the process. This option may not be required on all tablets. Once your tablet is reset, you'll be prompted to set it up as new.

steps.title: Set up your tablet as new.
steps.content: Set up your tablet as new. Log in with your Google account, and then follow the on-screen instructions to get your tablet back online. The setup process will also walk you through the process of protecting your Android with a new pattern, PIN, password, or biometric to unlock it in the future.

steps.title: Press the Power button on your tablet.
steps.content: Press the Power button on your tablet. This brings up the screen unlock feature. This method only works for Android 4.4 (KitKat) and earlier. [8] X Research source You'll also need to know the username and password for the Google account associated with this tablet.

steps.title: Try to guess the pattern.
steps.content: Try to guess the pattern. After guessing incorrectly a few times, you'll see a message that "Forgot Pattern?"

steps.title: Tap Forgot Pattern.
steps.content: Tap Forgot Pattern .

steps.title: Enter your Google username and password.
steps.content: Enter your Google username and password. Use the login info for the Google account that's connected to the tablet.

steps.title: Tap Sign In.
steps.content: Tap Sign In .

steps.title: Draw a new lock pattern and tap Continue.
steps.content: Draw a new lock pattern and tap Continue . Your new lock pattern will take effect immediately.
